content.title: Rajiv Gandhi Scholarship For Academic Excellence
content.department: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
content.details: Hon’ble Chief Minister of Rajasthan Sh. Ashok Gehlot announced this scheme on 20th August 2021 in commemoration of late Shri Rajiv Gandhi, former Prime Minister of India. In order to provide financial assistance to meritorious students of Rajasthan to study in top foreign universities of the world.
benefits: Tuition Fees and Bench fee: Max 50 lakh for family gross annual income less than 8 Lakh
Living Expenses: 12 Lakh Rupees for family gross annual income less than 8 Lakh
One-time advance of Rs 3 Lakh to candidates who will start their course after application on the portal
Tuition Fees and Bench fee: Max 50 lakh for family gross annual income 8 – 25 Lakh
Living Expenses: 6 Lakh Rupees for family gross annual income 8 – 25 Lakh
Tuition Fees and Bench fee: Max 50 lakh for family gross annual income above 25 Lakh
No Living Expenses for family gross annual income above 25 Lakh
eligibility: Less than 35 years of age on 1st July 2023
Admitted / Obtained offer letter in top 150 World QS ranked Universities as of 1st April, 2023
All disciplines for UG, PG, PhD and Post Doc courses
Maximum 7.5 % seats (37) for Engineering, Architecture, Medical, Dentistry courses at UG level
content.application_process: Online application through RajSSO Portal using SSOID.
documents_required: Offer letter of the applicable foreign university
Qualifying Degree, Mark sheet/Certificate of last passed exam
Self Declaration for Scholarships/ financial help etc. from other sources

faqs.question: Who can apply in the Scheme?
faqs.answer: Students of Rajasthan State domicile, less than 35 years as on 1st July of the financial year, and must have an offer letter from one of the top 1-150 Universities (QS World Ranking University).

faqs.question: Which courses are allowed in the Scheme?
faqs.answer: Post Doc, PhD, PG, and UG courses are allowed with specified maximum course durations.

faqs.question: Which documents are required to fill the application on portal?
faqs.answer: Jan Aadhar Number, Offer letter of the applicable foreign university, Bonafide/ Domicile certificate, Gross family Income certificate, Income Tax Return Proof, Affidavit for not filing ITR, 10th mark sheet, Qualifying Degree, Mark sheet/Certificate of last passed exam, Self Declaration for Scholarships/ financial help etc. from other sources, Passport, if any, Visa, if any, Aadhar Number.
